content.description: Climb a wider pod start to a bit of fingers and techy feet.
content.location: This is the left crack when you are belaying from the base of the gully. There are belay anchors down below. Bring helmets as your friends are walking around up top kicking dirt and pebbles all on your dome.

content.description: Two and a Half has easy dihedral climbing. It is a great beginner lead.
content.location:
It is immediately right of

Aldo the Apache

arete.

content.description: That's a Bingo! has fun, techy face climbing that trends right but cuts back left. It is short and sweet. Don't blow it at the top!
content.location:
As you are looking into the quarry (towards CO Hwy 141), it is on the right hand side. This ascends the blank face between the corner of "Bear Jew" and the broken up crack of "

SGT Stiglitz

."

content.description: Slippery Trout ascends jugs to start, but holds will get progressively smaller and more "slippery." A thought provoking crux and tense body positioning will bring you to the chains. Clip the anchors AFTER grabbing the top edge for a full pucker factor experience.
content.location: It is on the East face within The Quarry itself. This gets morning sun and afternoon shade. Belay off of flat the platform below.

It is just right of the blank face of

That's a Bingo

. This is located on the right hand side of the quarry as you are looking towards CO Hwy 141.

content.description:
This is a great first lead or a good TR for the kids. It has longer moves on big hold/rails - it is almost a step ladder!

Rappelling to get to the base of

Hans Landa

is best using these anchors.
content.location: It is the last route from the top on the south side of the quarry. See the topo.

content.description: Put It In Your Mouth has a delicate start in a shallow dihedral. Avoid using the huge ledge out left for full purchase.
content.location:
It is left of the

Aldo the Apache

arete. Walk in or rap from the top.

content.description: Ms. Kira Shakira is a great beginner lead. Follows big ledges to the top.
content.location:
It is right of the

Aldo the Apache

arete.

content.description: This has airy positioning to start the belay from. Move through some typical Unaweep bulges til you hit a ledge with a tree branch. Shuffle right on the plank til you reach a vertcal crack. Enjoy the not-so-staightforward crack all the way to the top. The route meanders a bit, but you will be following the path of least resistance.
content.location:
The route is just climber's right of

Hans Landa

, but to access it, you will want to stand the southwest corner of the quarry. Look for the anchors around the blocks with the attached name tag. Do a single rope rap to the belay anchors down below.

content.description: This climbs a right-facing dihedral corner that takes thinner gear in the beginning and gradually opens up. It has great movement through smaller cracks and is easier than it looks.
content.location: Located on the southwest corner of the quarry (see drawn topo).  Lower off bolted anchors to an obvious bulging ledge where the corner ends.  Lead or TR back out.

content.description: Boulder the short lived splitter with heinously slippery feet to a good ledge. A couple more gastons and sidepulls put you at a two bolt anchor. It's a shame that these moves didn't last longer!
content.protection: 3 bolts. I recommend you use a single carabiner for the first bolt if leading.
content.location: It is on the East-facing section within The Quarry. Belay off of the nice, flat platform.

content.description: Start on moderate but smooth and techy bulges to gain the crack to the right. Work your way up the crack, and make a decision to either head straight up or to cut back to the orange face. Both are about the same grade, and each have bolts for protection. My opinion is that the left orange face is the money sequence. I won't spoil the beta. Be mega proud if you get the onsight!
content.location: See the topo on the Quarry Proper main page. This route can be accessed by rappelling one of the upper routes to get to the lower platform and continuing to the base of the route. Belay anchors and finishing anchors are there. It might be more comfortable to belay the second from Sauerkraut Sandwich. The anchors on the top of the route can be used if you want to swap leads.

content.description: Start at the base of the route climbing pretty much a boulder, using chimney techniques. Stand on the lower ledge, and now transition on to the face to a techy/bulgy ending.

Start in the gully with bigger than fists and good feet. Shimmy up the crack to gain a stance. Bust out right following the bolt line up some very awesome holds and sequence. The only thing lame about this route is that it isn't longer! Bring the helmet.
content.location: On the West side of the quarry, facing you as you look in from the entrance are two obvious crack lines, Decoco is the right one. You can access from the top by mini-scrambling down to the anchors. Use any of the bolts located on the very top if you feel insecure scrambling down. The belay anchors are down below for your belayer if you want to lead it.

content.description: This route has surprisingly good movement on single to double pad crimps and edges. It is a good warm-up for the hands and meanders a bit, so don't be afraid to move left and right. There are probably 100 different ways to climb this thing.
content.location: On the south-facing end within The Quarry, this is the first route by the fix line when walking in.

content.description: This is pretty much a stack of boulders. It is a great first lead or good for children to TR.
content.location: As you approach the quarry, it will most likely be right at your feet as walk in. See the topo on the main page. It is located on the west side of the quarry facing CO Hwy 141.

content.description: This was the first route within the quarry. Climb some bulges on good edges, making your way to great stances. A couple of long reaches on great edges take you to the top. Avoid using the chimney or other wall for full value. Make sure to look out for those cool, shiny, scallop flakes that are on the wall from when they used to dynamite the area.
content.location: See the topo on main Quarry Proper page. This is located on the northwest corner of the quarry. Belay on the large, lower platform from bolted anchors, easily accessed from the top. This located near the large crack on the NW side.

content.description: Baby Dunk climbs a fun, leaning crack to gain the no-hands ledge. Move on jugs to the top. It has great movement but is too dang short.
content.location:
It is to the left of the black dihedral of

Put It In Your Mouth

.

content.description: Aldo the Apache is a roped boulder problem with a thin, reachy crux. A credit card sized hold may or may not have deteriorated over attempts. Get on it soon!
content.location: It is the arete on the southeast corner of the quarry. Rap in from anchors or carefully hike in and walk to the base of the route.
